channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023090078
item.description:
Report E-2023090078

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails of UN2014 combusted during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. PES personnel observed the hydrogen peroxide has evaporated. PES personnel over packed the three (3) 5-gallon pails into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All UN2014-impacted waste was staged onsite for terminal disposal.

  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5 gallon can of adhesive (un1133) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023080966
item.description:
Report E-2023080966

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN1823 Caustic Soda Micropearls release from (18) 50-pound paper bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 24-ounces of product released impacting a 4’ x 4’ area of the trailer and dock floors due to multiple bag punctures. All damaged bags were removed from the two pallets and all released product, along with cleanup debris and PPE were collected into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining bags were placed on pallets, re-stacked and secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET AND TORN. NO MARKINGS USED INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS. DAMAGED DURING OVERHEAD SORTATION. DescribePack: BOTH BOTTLES LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAPS AND BROKEN SEALS. SIX OUNCES OF MATERIALS LOSS. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023080848
item.description:
Report X-2023080848

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The shipment exterior packaging was wet on the top side and the box was removed from the sort stream and placed into a plastic lined container. DescribePack: One of the bottles of the shipment had a loose unsealed cap ; seepage had collected near the join to the rest of the body. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up with neutral absorbent material. The rest of the items in the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Managers called in for a spill. Upon arriving I noticed it was a hazmat and I equipped the proper PPE. I used absorbent to mitigate the spill, placed the package in a hazardous material bag and tote and brought to QA for processing. DescribePack: Bottle cap failed to seal, causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I placed absorbent mats to mitigate the leakage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from trailer and started leaking when placed on the rollers. QA was called and came right away. Package and any spilled liquid was bagged, binned, and taken to the processing cage. DescribePack: One of the four gallons inside has a loose lid and is 75% empty. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was called right away, package handlers were removed from the area, and package was taken to the hazmat processing cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was discovered to have discoloration on two sites on the box exterior and it was removed from the sort stream and put into a plastic lined container. DescribePack: Three of the bottles in the shipment had loose caps with moisture apparent around closure join to their bodies. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was sopped up with neutral absorbent materials. The rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection.

Item was placed in a hazmat bag and drum DescribePack: the failure was due to mishandling of the package which caused the lid to come loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: to mitigate the release item was placed in a hazmat bag and drum

item.title: Report E-2023080977
item.description:
Report E-2023080977

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, two (1) 5-gallon pails of ink were damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to a piece of plywood. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel overpacked the two (2) damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then cut up the impacted plywood, and secured the waste in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023081779
item.description:
Report X-2023081779

item.title: Report X-2023080755
item.description:
Report X-2023080755

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver arrived to VSA with the packages tilt over. The arrows weren't facing. When I pulled this particular Hazmat I noticed that it was wet and spilling. I placed the materials in a Hazmat bucket and noticed that only one of the gallons had actual spillage. The cap was not all the way closed. Van leakage was cleaned up. DescribePack: The cap was not screwed all the way on one particular gallon. Since the package wasn't placed with the arrows up it ended up spilling. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat bucket and isolated from the situation. The package ended up drying. DPR and ISF were then completed. Package was then placed in the hazmat cage.

item.description:

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG West unit was traveling on Muscatel Street in Hesperia, California. The driver hit an area of the roadway that was washed out due to rain. The trailer rolled over and approximately 2000 gallons of gasoline was released. Patriot Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
